seo.title: Staying safe in Positano & the Amalfi Coast
seo.description: Practical safety tips for buses, ferries, stairs, sun and emergencies around Positano and the Amalfi Coast.

linkLabel: Staying safe in Positano & the Amalfi Coast
intro: Positano is a safe destination, but the terrain, transport and summer heat can catch visitors by surprise.
Use the tips and checklists below to keep your trip stress‑free — especially on stairs, ferries and buses.

sections.title: Stairs & walking
body: Wear shoes with grip — many lanes are polished stone and slippery when wet.
Use handrails where available and take breaks on long climbs; there are drinking fountains around town.

sections.title: Buses & ferries
body: On buses, hold rails and keep backpacks off aisles; drivers brake often on hairpins.
On ferries, follow crew instructions and avoid standing near gangways as passengers board and disembark.

sections.title: Sun, sea & dehydration
body: Carry water and use SPF 30+; shade is limited on beaches and paths.
Swim only in designated areas and watch boat traffic when snorkeling near rocks.

a: Yes. Petty crime is rare; stick to lit stairs and lanes and you’ll be fine.

faqs.q: What number do I call in an emergency?
a: Dial 112 — the EU emergency number for police, ambulance and fire services.
